alert.note: Alert for Madison; Rankin; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:39PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rankin, northwestern Scott and southeastern Madison Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 638 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brandon, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fannin around 650 PM CDT. Goshen Springs around 655 PM CDT. Pisgah around 700 PM CDT. Leesburg around 710 PM CDT. Branch around 715 PM CDT. Forkville around 720 PM CDT. Ludlow around 725 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Mississippi.
